results.title: The Big dig
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Marje Aleck
results.brief_description: Follows a team of archaeologists and students working on the Gezer archaeological expedition as they explore the remains of the city of Gezer in ancient Philistia, now in Israel. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: The Big deal on Maddona Street = I soliti ignoto = Persons unknown = The usual unidentified thieves
results.creator_credit: Franco Cristaldi, Lux Film and Mario Monicelli
results.brief_description: This now classic Italian spoof on the caper film, about a group of incompetent amateur crooks who plan an elaborate but misguided robbery on a store, was hugely successful in both Italy and the United States. Primarily a take-off of Dassian’s ‘Rififi’ (1955), its comedy of errors is firmly rooted in social conditions of deprivation. Moncelli uses the conventions of the heist film to maximum effect and adds a steady stream of sight gags played out by an impeccable cast featuring Vittorio Gassman, Renato Salvatori, Claudia Cardinale and Marcello Mastroianni, with hilarious results. The jazz score by Piero Umiliani is also notable. From a story by Age Scarpelli. Credits: Director, Mario Monicelli ; writers, Age Scarpelli, Suso Cecchi D’amico, Mario Monicelli ; photography, Erico Menczer ; music, Piero Umiliani. Nominated for an Oscar for Best Foreign Film in 1958.

results.title: The Big day
results.creator_credit: Audio Visual Workshop and Chris Fitchett

results.title: The Big blue
results.creator_credit: Patrice Ledoux, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Luc Besson
results.brief_description: This is the poignant story of Jacques Mayol (Jean-Marc Barr), a free diving champion who must choose between his passion for the sea and his love of a New York businesswoman (Rosanna Arquette). His mettle as a human being is tested when he finds he must choose between two vastly different lifestyles. One with the passionate woman in one of the worlds largest cities and the other in a small village close to the sea which has always been his life. An extraordinarily beautiful film set against spectacular backdrops in Sicily, Paris, New York and the Greek Isles.

results.title: The Big bang
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone and Coastal Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 17 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
Once Hubble’s Law was accepted; that is the Law of an Expanding Universe, two theories about the creation of the universe were put forward. The Big Bang Theory stated that an initial tiny volume of matter exploded outwards, thus creating the beginnings of the universe. The Steady State Theory put forward by Sir Fred Hoyle, proposed that the universe never had a beginning but that matter was created as the universe expanded. The latter theory was abandoned by scientists, however the quest to determine the age and origin of the cosmos is still of vital importance for astronomers.

results.title: The Big backyard: the outback of South Australia
results.creator_credit: Peter Dimond, Milton Ingerson Film and Television Productions and Igor Auzins
results.brief_description: A young couple, on their honeymoon, travel in a four-wheel drive vehicle to the north and north-eastern areas of South Australia On their journey they see many points of interest including the opal mines of Coober Pedy, Lake Eyre, the Birdsville Track and Sturt’s Stony Desert and the varying barren landscapes of the outback of Australia. Cast: Christina Mackay and Bill Cain. Photographer: David Foreman.

results.title: The Bif if
results.creator_credit: Vivienne King and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Looks at research being done on the drug Interferon. It is a substance that has been shown to have an effect on some viruses and tumors and scientists are hopeful that it will cure cancer and other life threatening diseases. A cheap synthetic version, if developed, would enable scientists to meet current world demand.

results.title: The Bicyclist
results.creator_credit: Nordisk Film Junior and Kobenhavns Politi
results.brief_description: A safety education film presented from the point of view of a red bicycle, owned first by a boy who obeyed the traffic rules and then by one who brought himself and the bicycle to a sad fate. The first boy is seen riding sensibly on the road and passing a police cycling test. The bicycle is then stolen by a lad whose reckless riding leads to a serious accident to himself and the bicycle falling into the river to rust. The film brings out a number of specific points about safe and dangerous cycling.
